subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] why  'why'?
msgSnippet: ... I pronounce these words exactly the same, as I believe most English speakers do. So while they represent a minimal pair for some speakers, for most they
messageBody:
Benct Philip Jonsson wrote:
>

>
> _Wear_ and _where_, _wet_ and _whet_.
>
> I'm sure there are more, but I'd agree the functional
> load is low.
>

>

I pronounce these words exactly the same, as I believe most English
speakers do. So while they represent a minimal pair for some speakers,
for most they are homophones--at least that is my understanding.

> Now if someone can prove there are no /h/ -- /N/
> minimal pairs...

Did you mean /n/ --/N/?

Paul
